issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
After performing a warm upgrade from 3.3.2 to 3.4.0 no instances are able to access metadata. Restarting the CC again fixes the problem.

To reproduce:
1. Install 3.3.2 system and start instances.
2. Perform package upgrade to 3.4.0 and start services.
3. SSH into instances and attempt to access metadata.

Rule missing from the nat table:
{code}
DNAT       tcp  --  anywhere             169.254.169.254     tcp dpt:http to:192.168.2.3:8773
{code}

IP Tables post-upgrade:
{code}
[root@c-4 ~]# iptables -L
Chain INPUT (policy ACCEPT)
target     prot opt source               destination         

Chain FORWARD (policy DROP)
target     prot opt source               destination         
EUCA_COUNTERS_OUT  all  --  anywhere             anywhere            
EUCA_COUNTERS_IN  all  --  anywhere             anywhere            
ACCEPT     all  --  anywhere             anywhere            ctstate ESTABLISHED 
ACCEPT     all  --  anywhere            !172.16.0.0/16       
/Xn12A5USrYQ2G/npxnPpQ==  all  --  anywhere             anywhere            
ACCEPT     all  --  172.16.244.0/27      172.16.244.0/27     

Chain OUTPUT (policy ACCEPT)
target     prot opt source               destination         

Chain /Xn12A5USrYQ2G/npxnPpQ== (1 references)
target     prot opt source               destination         
ACCEPT     tcp  --  anywhere             172.16.244.0/27     tcp dpt:ssh 

Chain EUCA_COUNTERS_IN (1 references)
target     prot opt source               destination         
           all  --  anywhere             172.16.0.0/16       
           all  --  anywhere             172.16.244.19       
           all  --  anywhere             172.16.244.25       
           all  --  anywhere             172.16.244.29       

Chain EUCA_COUNTERS_OUT (1 references)
target     prot opt source               destination         
           all  --  172.16.0.0/16        anywhere            
           all  --  172.16.244.19        anywhere            
           all  --  172.16.244.25        anywhere            
           all  --  172.16.244.29        anywhere            
[root@c-4 ~]# iptables -t nat -L
Chain PREROUTING (policy ACCEPT)
target     prot opt source               destination         
DNAT       all  --  anywhere             192.168.2.102       to:172.16.244.19 
DNAT       all  --  anywhere             192.168.2.101       to:172.16.244.25 
DNAT       all  --  anywhere             192.168.2.100       to:172.16.244.29 

Chain POSTROUTING (policy ACCEPT)
target     prot opt source               destination         
SNAT       all  --  172.16.244.29        anywhere            to:192.168.2.100 
SNAT       all  --  172.16.244.25        anywhere            to:192.168.2.101 
SNAT       all  --  172.16.244.19        anywhere            to:192.168.2.102 
MASQUERADE  all  --  172.16.0.0/16       !172.16.0.0/16       

Chain OUTPUT (policy ACCEPT)
target     prot opt source               destination         
DNAT       all  --  anywhere             192.168.2.102       to:172.16.244.19 
DNAT       all  --  anywhere             192.168.2.101       to:172.16.244.25 
DNAT       all  --  anywhere             192.168.2.100       to:172.16.244.29
{code}

Metadata IP address is present on the CC's interface:
{code}
[root@c-4 ~]# ip -4 addr show
1: lo: <LOOPBACK,UP,LOWER_UP> mtu 16436 qdisc noqueue state UNKNOWN 
    inet 127.0.0.1/8 scope host lo
2: eth0: <BROADCAST,MULTICAST,UP,LOWER_UP> mtu 1500 qdisc pfifo_fast state UP qlen 1000
    inet 169.254.169.254/32 scope link eth0
    inet 192.168.2.4/24 brd 192.168.2.255 scope global eth0
    inet 172.16.244.1/27 brd 172.16.244.31 scope global eth0
    inet 192.168.2.102/32 scope global eth0
    inet 192.168.2.101/32 scope global eth0
    inet 192.168.2.100/32 scope global eth0
{code}
fields.summary: Instances cannot access metadata after warm upgrade
fields.environment:
Eucalyptus 3.4.0-0.0.1600.20131008git148411fc

Machine 1: CLC Walrus
Machine 2: CC SC
Machine 3: NC

comments.body:
Previous sosreport was taken prior to the upgrade. It looks like the problem occurs here:

{code}

2013-10-07 21:35:41 DEBUG 000018473 http_get_timeout         | from http://192.168.2.3:8773/latest/network-topology

2013-10-07 21:35:42 DEBUG 000018391 doEnableService          | waiting for monitor to re-initialize (2/60)

2013-10-07 21:35:49 DEBUG 000018391 doEnableService          | waiting for monitor to re-initialize (9/60)

2013-10-07 21:35:50 DEBUG 000018473 http_get_timeout         | saved image in /tmp/euca-clcnet-uIHxHZ
2013-10-07 21:35:50 DEBUG 000018473 monitor_thread           | maintaining network state
2013-10-07 21:35:50 DEBUG 000018473 maintainNetworkState     | maintaining metadata redirect and tunnel health
2013-10-07 21:35:50 DEBUG 000018473 maintainNetworkState     | CCcloudIp=192.168.2.3 VNETcloudIp=0.0.0.0
2013-10-07 21:35:50  WARN 000018473 vnetUnsetMetadataRedirec | cloudIp is not yet set, not installing redirect rule
2013-10-07 21:35:50 DEBUG 000018473 vnetApplySingleTableRule | applying single table (nat) rule (-A PREROUTING -d 169.254.169.254/32 -p tcp -m tcp --dport 80 -j DNAT --to-destination 192.168.2.3:8773)
2013-10-07 21:35:50 DEBUG 000018364 doDescribeResources      | invoked: userId=eucalyptus, vmLen=18
2013-10-07 21:35:50 DEBUG 000018364 init_thread              | init=1 0x7fdf09e8b000 0x7fde876ca000 0x7fdebe32b000 0x7fdebe125000
2013-10-07 21:35:50  WARN 000018364 vnetInitTunnels          | in MANAGED-NOVLAN mode, priv interface 'eth0' must be a bridge, tunneling disabled
2013-10-07 21:35:50 DEBUG 000018364 doDescribeResources      | resources summary ({avail/max}): m1.small{0/0} t1.micro{0/0} m1.medium{0/0} c1.medium{0/0} m1.large{0/0}
2013-10-07 21:35:50 DEBUG 000018365 init_thread              | init=1 0x7fdf09e8b000 0x7fde876ca000 0x7fdebe32b000 0x7fdebe125000
{code}

I've attach another sosreport that is post-upgrade.
Yep. Based on this snapshot, the NAT rule was installed.

Ok... I found where we disabled the metadata service... Question is what was the call path

{noformat}
2013-10-07 21:56:40 DEBUG 000018368 doDescribePublicAddresse | invoked: userId=eucalyptus
2013-10-07 21:56:41 DEBUG 000018364 init_thread              | init=1 0x7fdf09e8b000 0x7fde876ca000 0x7fdebe32b000 0x7fdebe125000
2013-10-07 21:56:41  WARN 000018364 vnetInitTunnels          | in MANAGED-NOVLAN mode, priv interface 'eth0' must be a bridge, tunneling disabled
2013-10-07 21:56:41 DEBUG 000018364 doShutdownService        | invoked: userId=admin
2013-10-07 21:56:41 DEBUG 000018473 vnetApplySingleTableRule | applying single table (nat) rule (-D PREROUTING -d 169.254.169.254/32 -p tcp -m tcp --dport 80 -j DNAT --to-destination 192.168.2.3:8773)
2013-10-07 21:56:41 DEBUG 000018473 clean_network_state      | running command '///usr/lib/eucalyptus/euca_rootwrap ip addr del 192.168.2.100/32 dev eth0'
2013-10-07 21:56:41 DEBUG 000018473 clean_network_state      | running command '///usr/lib/eucalyptus/euca_rootwrap ip addr del 192.168.2.101/32 dev eth0'
2013-10-07 21:56:41 DEBUG 000018473 clean_network_state      | running command '///usr/lib/eucalyptus/euca_rootwrap ip addr del 192.168.2.102/32 dev eth0'
2013-10-07 21:56:41 DEBUG 000018473 safekillfile             | calling safekill with pid 20818
2013-10-07 21:56:41 DEBUG 000018473 vnetApplySingleTableRule | applying single table (filter) rule (-D FORWARD -s 172.16.244.0/27 -d 172.16.244.0/27 -j ACCEPT)
2013-10-07 21:56:41 DEBUG 000018473 vnetDelGatewayIP         | removing gateway IP: 172.16.244.1
2013-10-07 21:56:41 DEBUG 000018473 hash_b64enc_string       | in=069842047593d4995211-b2d6-455d-bd17-84951920f771
2013-10-07 21:56:41 DEBUG 000018473 hash_b64enc_string       | in=069842047593d4995211-b2d6-455d-bd17-84951920f771
2013-10-07 21:56:41 DEBUG 000018473 vnetApplySingleTableRule | applying single table (filter) rule (-L /Xn12A5USrYQ2G/npxnPpQ== -n)
2013-10-07 21:56:41 DEBUG 000018473 vnetDeleteChain          | params: userName=069842047593, netName=d4995211-b2d6-455d-bd17-84951920f771, rc=0
2013-10-07 21:56:41 DEBUG 000018473 vnetApplySingleTableRule | applying single table (filter) rule (-D FORWARD -j /Xn12A5USrYQ2G/npxnPpQ==)
2013-10-07 21:56:41 DEBUG 000018473 vnetDeleteChain          | duplicate rule found, removing others: 0/10
2013-10-07 21:56:41 DEBUG 000018473 vnetApplySingleTableRule | applying single table (filter) rule (-D FORWARD -j /Xn12A5USrYQ2G/npxnPpQ==)
2013-10-07 21:56:41 DEBUG 000018473 vnetDeleteChain          | vnetDeleteChain(): flushing 'filter' table
{noformat}
Currently working on it. This seems to be related with a failed "disable service" request received by the CC from CLC...

OK, I found the problem.

The CC restarted after upgrade at 21:35 and the rule got installed. At 21:40 the CC re-restored the network and wiped out the NAT rules which flushed the redirect rule and we only apply this rule when CLC IP changed. Since we already had learned the CLC IP, we are not re-installing itâ€¦ BUG...

{noformat}
2013-10-07 21:40:10 DEBUG 000018473 restoreNetworkState      | restarting iptables
2013-10-07 21:40:10 DEBUG 000018473 vnetApplySingleTableRule | applying single table (filter) rule (-F)
2013-10-07 21:40:10 DEBUG 000018473 vnetApplySingleTableRule | applying single table (nat) rule (-F)
{noformat}

[~mclark]

I believe the best way to validate the fix is to run some instances and:

1) stop both CC and NC once the instance is running
2) start the CC
3) wait 10 minutes
4) using iptables-save confirm that we do have the metadata redirect rule installed
5) start the NC
6) looking at the CC log, wait to see the following message:
"syncNetworkState(): network sync implies network restore is necessary"
7) Confirm that the metadata redirect rule is still installed

the problem seem to occur when we are doing a network sync...

Thanks [~chuck]. I used the above procedure on a build that contains the bug to verify that the steps reproduce the problem. I then updated to a build that includes the fix to verify that it is fixed.

State of IP tables prior to stopping services:
{code}
*nat
:PREROUTING ACCEPT [26142:1581016]
:POSTROUTING ACCEPT [22300:1339488]
:OUTPUT ACCEPT [22290:1338728]
-A PREROUTING -d 192.168.2.100/32 -j DNAT --to-destination 172.16.211.78 
-A PREROUTING -d 192.168.2.102/32 -j DNAT --to-destination 172.16.211.88 
-A PREROUTING -d 192.168.2.101/32 -j DNAT --to-destination 172.16.211.79 
-A PREROUTING -d 169.254.169.254/32 -p tcp -m tcp --dport 80 -j DNAT --to-destination 192.168.2.3:8773 
-A POSTROUTING -s 172.16.211.79/32 -j SNAT --to-source 192.168.2.101 
-A POSTROUTING -s 172.16.211.88/32 -j SNAT --to-source 192.168.2.102 
-A POSTROUTING -s 172.16.211.78/32 -j SNAT --to-source 192.168.2.100 
-A POSTROUTING -s 172.16.0.0/16 ! -d 172.16.0.0/16 -j MASQUERADE 
-A OUTPUT -d 192.168.2.100/32 -j DNAT --to-destination 172.16.211.78 
-A OUTPUT -d 192.168.2.102/32 -j DNAT --to-destination 172.16.211.88 
-A OUTPUT -d 192.168.2.101/32 -j DNAT --to-destination 172.16.211.79 
COMMIT
{code}

{code}
*nat
:PREROUTING ACCEPT [26333:1592396]
:POSTROUTING ACCEPT [22372:1343891]
:OUTPUT ACCEPT [22361:1343055]
-A PREROUTING -d 169.254.169.254/32 -p tcp -m tcp --dport 80 -j DNAT --to-destination 192.168.2.3:8773 
-A POSTROUTING -s 172.16.0.0/16 ! -d 172.16.0.0/16 -j MASQUERADE 
COMMIT
{code}

Waited for syncNetworkState message:

{code}
/var/log/eucalyptus/cc.log:2013-10-11 09:48:13 DEBUG 000006331 syncNetworkState         | syncNetworkState(): syncing public/private IP mapping ground truth with local state
/var/log/eucalyptus/cc.log:2013-10-11 09:48:19 DEBUG 000006331 syncNetworkState         | syncNetworkState(): syncing public/private IP mapping ground truth with local state
